Harris Hua

55 H Street NW · Washington, DC 20001 · (306) 408-6606 · yh726@georgetown.edu

Ask me anything about startups and the venture capital world. I have been working as an entrepreneur since 2018. Prior to that, I was an investment analyst in an early-stage venture capital firm in the Bay Area.

Experience

Co-Founder and Co-CEO

MengMax Studio

I led the company's growth from 12 to over 50 employees, raising millions in equity and generating millions in revenue. I initiated the pioneering Chinese Sports NFT project with the Chinese Basketball Association, achieving millions in GMV within six months. Additionally, our studio successfully launched popular toy lines and NFTs, attracting 300k+ fans and generating significant revenue, while securing lucrative advertising contracts with global brands like AB InBev and NBA China. I also managed the development of a mobile game that drew 1M+ registered users, enhancing team productivity by 20%.

December 2018 - July 2022

Investment Associate

CRCM Ventures

I established a cross-border entrepreneurship network, identifying over 400 startups across AI, AR/VR, and Blockchain. I closed 5 early-stage deals and facilitated a significant valuation increase and seed investment in Xinji. I supported global expansions of key portfolio companies like Youku and Ripple. Previously, as an Investment Analyst, I managed a Series A round for Spin, later acquired by Ford for $100M. I also increased our deal flow pipeline by 15% with a new branch office in Palo Alto.

September 2016 - November 2018

Interests

I have a diverse range of interests that keep me both physically active and creatively engaged. Working out is an essential part of my routine, providing me with the physical fitness and mental clarity needed to tackle daily challenges. In addition to my fitness regime, I am passionate about ceramics, where the tactile experience of molding clay offers a unique creative outlet. My appreciation for tangible art extends into art collectibles, where I enjoy discovering and acquiring pieces that not only enhance my living space but also serve as investments. Hiking allows me to connect with nature and explore new landscapes, offering a refreshing break from the urban environment. Lastly, playing basketball not only keeps me active but also sharpens my teamwork and strategic thinking skills, as the fast-paced nature of the game demands quick decision-making and effective collaboration. Together, these activities contribute to a balanced lifestyle, fostering both my physical well-being and my artistic sensibilities.

  • I haven't received any formal accolades yet, so I've awarded myself the title of 'Self-Motivated Master of Innovation.'
